title: Speed
excerpt: The distance in feet a creature can cover when it moves on its turn. Special movement types like climbing and swimming have specific rules.

subEntries.title: Movement Types
subEntries.excerpt: Rules for specific kinds of movement.

subEntries.title: Climbing
subEntries.excerpt: While climbing, each foot of movement costs 1 extra foot. A successful DC 15 Strength (Athletics) check may be required for difficult surfaces.

subEntries.title: Crawling
subEntries.excerpt: While crawling, each foot of movement costs 1 extra foot. Crawling is often associated with the Prone condition.

subEntries.title: Flying
subEntries.excerpt: A variety of effects allow a creature to fly. While flying, you fall if you have the Incapacitated or Prone condition or your Fly Speed is reduced to 0.

subEntries.title: Jumping
subEntries.excerpt: When you jump, you make either a Long Jump (horizontal) or a High Jump (vertical), both of which are based on your Strength score.

subEntries.title: Swimming
subEntries.excerpt: While swimming, each foot of movement costs 1 extra foot. A successful DC 15 Strength (Athletics) check may be required for rough water.

subEntries.title: Special Speeds
subEntries.excerpt: Rules for creatures that have multiple speeds, such as a walking speed and a flying speed, and how to switch between them during a move.

subEntries.title: Changes to Your Speeds
subEntries.excerpt: If an effect increases or decreases your Speed for a time, any special speed you have (Climb, Fly, etc.) increases or decreases by an equal amount for the same duration.
